name: Organic Essential Oils - Custom Designed Combinations
description:
Have you ever wanted to get yourself Organic Essential Oils when creating and making up your own cosmetic recipes and found it overly expensive? Especially say when you only needed a teaspoon or a few drops to make up your latest batch of soy based candles like we do, or make your own skin care products like massage oil at home?

We created an alternative and affordable solution for you then going broke to set up shop!

We will make up any combination you would like - just check out our list of organic essential oils we carry (and btw - this list grows with every week too!) Upon checkout from our online shop you can then let us know in the comments section which combinations (if any) you would like.


Upon receiving your order, we will then make up your custom-designed 1-dram green glass bottle with dropper of any essential oil you see here listed  - or a combination of your choice!

A 1-dram bottle equals .75 or Â¾ of a teaspoon (75 drops) or (3.7 ml)


It is a perfect size to use when adding drops into your favorite unscented candle (or when you are making your own candles per se) or in your own homemade cosmetics you create.

A 1-dram bottle of our organic essential oils is $ 10.00
Starred (*) Essential Oils of Sandalwood & Chamomile are $18.00 each
And Combination of Essential Oils that contain 30% (~22 drops) or more of Sandalwood or Chamomile will be $15.00 each.
Let Us Customize Your Own Essential Oil Combinations & Scents!


Allspice
Bergamot
Black pepper
Cardamom
Carrot seed
Cedarwood

Cinnamon leaf

Simply let us know which combinations you would like...when you place your order. If you have any questions our email is sales@heartandsoulofbeacon.com.

For Example a 1 dram bottle uses 75 drops - and you would like a grounding and soothing essential oil combination...You then request the following when placing your custom oil combination.

50 drops lavender
15 drops patchouli
10 drops Clary Sage

We will then custom create your blend and send it to you in our dark green glass 1 dram bottle with glass dropper & have it labeled for you along with it being properly secured for safe mailing to you in a  bubbled packaging.

Currently we can only shop in the continental United States & Canada. Shipping is $6.00 for up to four 1 dram sized bottles in the USA and $7.00 for up to four 1 dram sized bottles in Canada.

name: Calming Chi Tea - Organic Loose Tea Great for Children and All by The Lucky Zen Dog
description:
Our Calming Chi Tea - which is an Organic Loose Herbal Tea for Kids and for All who wish to be a bit less frazzled was designed with you and (your child in mind) when one needs to calm down...

This infusion bled of tea has a minty flavor - and is especially great before bedtime to help ease one into sleep. Can be easily made into an iced tea as well.

Ingredients are all 100% organic and include: spearmint, catnip, chamomile flowers, skullcap, raspberry leaf, calendula flowers and a pinch of organic stevia leaf.

Each bag of tea is filled with over 2 cups in volume of loose tea and includes a reusable organic cotton muslin tea bag. Steeping instructions - we suggest 1 to 2 teaspoons per 1 8 ounce cup of boiling water and let steep for anywhere from 5 to 15 minutes.

Our amazing natural and organic body and room sprays are a wonderful alternative to those containing unnatural and unhealthy ingredients.

Our four ounce aluminum bottles have easy to use squirt tops providing a gentle mist of our fragrances. Simply shake prior to using.

Every one of our body and room mists can be used to spray and use as a linen spray, room spray, body spray.

The 'Relaxed Chi' has wonderful aromas of Lavender and Cedarwood with a touch of woodsy rose. Ingredients: Pure distilled water, silver hydrosol (natural preservative), double distilled organic witch hazel, organic rose hydrosol water and organic essential oils of lavender and cedarwood.

Our 'Vavoom Zen' Fragrance is a wonderful uplifting fragrance containing one of our most crowd pleasing scent combinations of Eucalyptus and Spearmint. Ingredients: Pure distilled water, silver hydrosol (natural preservative), double distilled organic witch hazel, kosher vegetable glycerin (for fragrance staying power) and organic essential oils of Spearmint, Peppermint and Eucalyptus.

Each and every one of our products are made carefully and with love to ensure consistency with each batch.

Enjoy natural products that are not harmful to either you or your environment!

Our unique and special blend is made up of all organic ingredients: cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom, black pepper, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon and bay leaves.


We also carry many other spices and herb blends. We often sell five for $20 - so we will create a separate listing for that.

name: Tea Tree Essential Oil 100% Certified Organic by The Lucky Zen Dog
description:
Tea Tree Essential Oil 100% Certified Organic by The Lucky Zen Dog is a wonderful topical essential oil to have around the house. 

This is for a 1 dram sized glass bottle with dropper. 

20 Great Ways to Use Tea Tree Oil

For Health

1. Use a dab to treat acne.
2. An anti-fungal for treating Athleteâs Foot, eczema, various yeast infections, etc.
3. An antiseptic to be used on cuts and burns.
4. An anti-viral: it may lessen the symptoms of colds and flu. Try using a few drops in the bath.
5. Add to a vaporizer to loosen chest congestion.
6. Add a small amount to shampoo to destroy head lice.
7. A small amount added to your bath can help with persistent body odor.
8. Treating sinus infection.
9. For dandruff and dry scalp.
10. In the form of aromatherapy, tea tree oil is used to treat colds, persistent coughs, acne, toothaches, and sunburn.

For Cleaning

11. To create an all-purpose cleaner, combine 2 teaspoons of tea tree oil in 2 cups of water in a spray bottle.
12. Another version would be 14 ounces of water with 1 ounce of Murphyâs oil soap and 10 drops of tea tree oil.
13. Mix the above solution with kosher salt to scrub bathtub and bathroom tiles.
14. Add a few drops to dishwasher dispenser, then fill with a green dishwashing soap.
15. A few drops added to each load of laundry leave your clothes smelling cleaner.
16. Control mold with a tea tree oil/water spray.
17. Remove mustiness with that same tea tree oil/water spray.
18. To keep germs at bay, spray it on high chairs, car seats, and other high traffic spots.
19. 15 drops in a quart of water can be an effective insect repellent.
20. Be sure to take some with you when hiking and camping to put directly on insect bites or blisters.


Read more: http://www.care2.com/greenliving/20-great-uses-for-tea-tree-oil.html#ixzz2HhTSbbVx

artists.name: The Lucky Zen Dog Organic Line

name: Lavender Essential Oil 100% Certified Organic by The Lucky Zen Dog
description:
Lavender Essential Oil 100% Certified Organic by The Lucky Zen Dog - is a true highly concentrated essential oil for use in creating your own balms, refreshing your pot pourris and for your own medicinal uses.

This is a 1 dram sized dark green glass bottle with dropper. Larger sized bottles are available upon request - just ask us!

Here is a useful list of just some of the things you can do with Essential Lavender Oil:

Aching Muscles
If youâve spent a back-breaking afternoon in the garden, jump into a lavender bath to soothe aches & pains away. Apply Epsom salts & a few drops of Lavender Oil to the bath and soak away the tension.

Acne
Lavender is one of the most valuable oils for the treatment of acne, according to aromatherapists. âIt inhibits the bacteria that cause the skin infection, helps to re-balance the over-secretion of sebum, which the bacteria thrive on, and reduce scarringâ. Add a few drops of lavender oil to a plain cream sold by chemists and use as a moisturizer or cleanser.

Bugs & Bacteria
French laboratory studies in the early 20th century showed that lavender is a powerful antibacterial in dilutions of 5 per cent or less it is lethal to bacteria that cause typhoid, TB & diphtheria. Combined with Lemon Balm, for its clinically tested anti-viral properties.

Burns (minor)
After you have cooled the area by immersing it in running cold water for 5 minutes, gently stroke on neat lavender oil. Pain relief is almost immediate, and burn usually heals without scarring.

Cuts & Wounds
Apply lavender oil to sooth pain, prevent bacterial infection and aid scar-free healing. Apply neat.

Earache
Warm a bottle of lavender oil in hot water for a minute or two, then gently massage a few drops into the skin around the ears and throat. For babies & small children, add 2-3 drops of the warmed oil to a little olive oil and massage in the same way.

Eczema
Stroke infused lavender oil (a few drops of lavender oil & carrier oil) into dry, itchy skinâsmall children will find this especially comforting or add a few drops of lavender oil to calamine lotion, shake before use.

Fatigue
Add 5 drops of lavender oil to a hot foot bath and relax while your feet soak in it. The soles of the feet are particularly porous, so lavender reaches your bloodstream very quickly, exerting its stimulating and soothing effects on various systems of your body.

Fevers
For babies or small children, sponge them down very gently with tepid water to which you have added a drop of lavender oil. Take care not to let them get chilled. This works for adults too.

Giddy Spells, Faintness or Palpitations
Make your own smelling saltsâsea salt , lavender oil, peppermint oil & basil oil.

Headache
The distilled water of Lavender (Hydrosol) Mist around your head, is refreshing and soothing. Alternatively, make a compress of a piece of cause or muslin soaked in icy cold water then sprinkled with a few drops of lavender oil and apply to the forehead, or massage a few drops into the forehead, temples and nape of the neck.

Insomnia
In a number of small studies, elderly psychiatric patients have been shown to sleep better and be more alert during the day when their sleep medication is replaced with lavender oil either dropped on their pillows, or placed in a diffuser on the ward. To help to induce sleep, put 3 or 4 drops of lavender oil on your pillow. For babies, add 1 drop of lavender oil & geranium oil in carrier oil and massage into a babies back or a few drops in their bedtime bath.

And with frankincense long hailed for its preserving and embalming properties, weâve incorporated just enough of this luxury ingredient in order to continue tradition, to preserve the skins' existing integrity, 'fill" the skin with essential fatty acids and protect it from further damage. Concentrated, elegant, luxurious.

To Use, you simply apply a smooth pea size amount of this powerhouse anti-aging moisturizer over face and neck. Allow 3-4 minutes to soak into skin. May be used morning or night.

This gentle, effective cleanser is capable of removing accumulated grime and waterproof make-up. The organic jojoba oil has the additional benefit of suppressing sebum production in oily skin and increasing it in dry, leaving skin that's balanced and conditioned. Your skin will remain supple and nourished between use.

Dampen a cotton pad with water. Apply cleanser to pad and smooth over neck, face and eyelids. Wipe face until completely clean. Leave the last layer of cleanser on your skin. No need to rinse.

Ingredients:organic simmondsia chinensis (jojoba) seed oil, oenothera biennis (evening primrose) oil, prunus amygdalus dulcis (almond) oil, lavandula angustifolia (lavender) oil, beeswax, silver hydrosol (natural preservative), tocopherol (vitamin e), melaleuca alternifolia (tea tree) leaf oil, zingiber officinale (ginger) root oil, pelargonium graveolens (geranium) oil, organic camellia sinensis (lemon - ginger) leaf tea.

olive oil cleansing bar off cuts, organic hibiscus flowers, rosehips, round chilies, bay leaves, eucalyptus leaves, rose leaves, cinnamon bark, long chilies, cloves, orange or lemon peel, star anise, essential oils of organic orange and lemongrass

ingredients: saponified oils of organic cocos nucifera (coconut), organic olea europaea (olive), organic simmondsia chinensis (jojoba) seed oil, organic aloe barbadensis leaf juice, essential oils of schoenanthus (lemongrass), eucalyptus radiata leaf, citrus medica limonum (lemon) and lavandula angustifolia (lavender), rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary) leaf extract.

name: Calendula Flowers Certified Organic by The Lucky Zen Dog
description: Our Calendula Flowers are 100% Certified Organic and are sold in one (1) bags - roughly the equivalent of two cups in volume. Calendula Flowers have been used for centuries in teas, infusions, creams, compresses, washes and tinctures in helping people heal what might ail them. Here is a recipe on how to make your very own Calendula Herbal Oil: This medicinal oil is simple to prepare and has so many uses. The gentle, soothing, and healing oil is perfect for cradle cap, diaper rash, chapped or chafed skin, bruises, and sore or inflamed muscles. The oil can be used alone, or incorporated into salves, massage oils, lip balms, ointments, creams, and lotions. Organic Olive oil Organic Calendula flowers 1. Place Calendula flowers in a clean, dry glass jar. If using fresh Calendula, wilt for 12 hours to remove most of the moisture (too much moisture will cause the oil to go rancid) before adding to the jar. Pour olive oil into the jar, making sure to cover the flowers by at least 1â of oil so they will have space to expand. Stir well and cap the jar tightly. 2. Place the jar in a warm, sunny windowsill and shake once or more per day. 3. After 4-6 weeks, strain the herbs out using cheesecloth. Pour the infused oil into glass bottles and store in a cool dark place. Heat Method: I prefer to infuse oils utilizing the solar or folk method described above, but heat can be applied if you need the oil quickly. To prepare, follow step 1 from above, but place the Olive oil and Calendula flowers in an uncovered container. Warm over low heat at approximately 100 degrees F for at least 3-5 hours, the longer the better. A yogurt maker, double boiler, or inside the oven with a pilot light on are all effective ways to heat the oil, just make sure to check the temperature occasionally to ensure that the oil isnât getting too warm. Once the oil has infused, strain out the herbs using cheesecloth and package the infused oil into glass bottles.

name: White Sage - Cermonial Smuding White Sage 100 Percent Organic
description:
Our 100% Organic White Sage is sold in one (1) oz bags is one of our in-store customers biggest favorites! 

It's perfect when you want to do smaller smudging 'jobs', when you wish to meditate, clean and clear space, your home, office, etc.

Here is a little historical information about Salvia Apiana "White Sage" T

The Cheyenne use the white sage in their Sun Dance and Standing Against Thunder ceremonies (Hart 1976). Other tribes who used white sage include the Arapaho, Comanche, Gros Ventre, Creek, Navaho, Tewa, and Ute (Nickerson 1966, Carlson and Jones 1939, Hart 1976, Thwaites 1905, Denig 1855, Elmore 1944, Robbins et al. 1916, Chamberlin 1909).

The Dakota and other tribes used white sage tea for stomach troubles and many other ailments (Gilmore 1977). The Cheyenne used the crushed leaves as snuff for sinus attacks, nosebleeds, and headaches (Hart 1976). The Crow made a salve for use on sores by mixing white sage with neck-muscle fat (probably from buffalo) (Hart 1976). They used a strong tea as an astringent for eczema and as a deodorant and an antiperspirant for underarms and feet. The Kiowa made a bitter drink from white sage, which they used to reduce phlegm and to relieve a variety of lung and stomach complaints (Vestal and Shultes 1939). Usually, they chewed the stem and leaves and swallowed the juice.

name: Organic Bug Spray - Bugger Off by Australian Scent

3.8 oz - $38

name: Kelp n' Honey Scrub by Australian Scent
description:
Kelp n' Honey Scrub is a unique power house formula, rich in essential fatty acids, vitamins A, E, K, and oceanic minerals, widely known to prevent dehydration and neutralize free-radicals. 

With organic, fair trade brown sugar and organic & free trade, rooibos tea, a fine grain scrub has been created to gently cleanse and exfoliate the face and body, without scratching or damaging the skin. Rich in natural glycolic acid and cell reconstructive enzymes, our Kelp n' Honey Scrub is also ideal for acne prone skin, assisting with the removal of pore-clogging, dead skin build-up. With collagen and elastin building ingredients and raw honey, an antimicrobial wonder, skin is left clean, hydrated and radiant. 

Expect to glow!

name: White Sage and Wild Mint Tea by Juniper Ridge
description:
Caffeine free Â· 20 unbleached tea bags per tin.

White Sage has a rich, earthy, minty flavor that made it a favorite tea for many of the Native American tribes and early settlers of the Southwest. I like to sip this tea during the wet winters here in Northern California and let my mind drift off to the hot desert country where White Sage grows. So many backpacking trips over the years in that beautiful, sunbaked countryâmaybe Iâll just sit here in the shade of this Palo Verde tree and let some of the afternoon heat pass while I nod off to sleep with the smell of Wild Sage in the air . . . Now you can enjoy this classic Southwestern tea and dream your own daydreams of the big rock, White Sage desert country. $12

name: Douglas Fir Incense by Junpier Ridge
description:
douglas fir Incense Â· $12

Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box


No tree is more deeply identified with the Pacific Northwest than Douglas Fir, which grows to enormous proportions, rivaling Redwoods in size, and forms pure stands over much of the Northwest. When burned, it has a wonderfully cozy, wood-smoke scent that might remind you of that time you camped on the Oregon Coast, when the light scent of Doug Fir campfires hung in the air as night settled in. 

So enjoy this reminder of the big tree and glacier country of the Pacific Northwest. $12 - 40 sticks - and yes, definitely made in the U.S.A.

name: Cedar Incense by Juniper Ridge
description:
cedar incense

Cedar Incense Â· $12

Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box


Siskiyou Cedar is found only in the remote, coastal mountains of the Pacific Northwestâs Siskiyou country. Most Cedar incenses are made with the perfumey- smelling essential oil of European Cedarâthat's why they donât smell anything like the Western Cedars we know and love. This is the only incense anywhere made with real Cedar from the Pacific Northwest. Burn a stick and let your mind drift away to the forests of the rugged Northwest. $12 for 40 sticks.

Made in the USA

name: Juniper Incense by Juniper Ridge
description:
Juniper Incense Â· $12

Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box

If youâve ever been to the Grand Canyon and nudged perilously close to the edge and wondered what that insane tree jutting out from the side of the cliff was, it was Juniper. Juniper covers vast portions of the Southwest and seems happily at home clinging to small ledges or peeking up between boulders on precipitous slopes. This incense captures the subtly sweet, cinnamon-like scent of Juniper and is reminiscent of backcountry campfires in the canyon country of the Southwest. $12 - Made in the USA

name: Essential Nourishment Cookbook by Marika Blossfeldt
description: Marika Blossfeldt is a local Beacon, NY author, speaker and coach. With so many delightful health-enhancing foods to choose from, there is no need to settle for second class nutrition. Marika enjoys guiding her clients to a place of abundant energy, strong immunity, genuine wellness, physical fitness and joyful living. The book is filled with amazing recipes and images of both the recipes and of her farm in Estonia. Visit Marika Blossfedlt's website www.MarikaB.com Her book ESSENTIAL NOURISHMENT has been nominated for the prestigious GOURMAND WORLD COOKBOOK AWARDS 2011. Marika is also the founder and director of POLLI TALU ARTS CENTER, an international center for the visual, performing and healing arts in her native Estonia, where she conducts yoga and wellness retreats during the summer months. Visit the Polli Talu Arts Center ****These are Original Signed Copies of the Author's Book!

name: PiÃ±on Incense by Juniper Ridge
description:
PiÃ±on Incense Â· $12

Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box


Although pine trees are commonly associated with alpine lakes, this member of the pine clan has strayed out into the hot deserts of the Southwest.

And like a black sheep rebel who can't stand the crowded conformity of the mountains, this desert dweller splays its twisted branches wildly and generally gets its groove on where no one can tell it what to do. 

This incense evokes winter nights in the Southwest, where PiÃ±on is burned as firewood and its sweet, resiny scent drifts through the air. $12.00 Made in the USA.

name: Sweetgrass Incense by Juniper Ridge
description:
Sweetgrass Incense Â· $12

Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box

Sweetgrass is found in alpine meadows throughout the mountainous regions of the West, from Alaska south to the Rockies and Sierra Nevada. 

It is one of the treasured plants of native tribes in Canada and the American West, who use it ceremonially along with White Sage.  

When burned, it has a lovely, soft, vanilla-like scent and a centering energy that evokes the ephemeral, shimmering green mountain meadows where it grows. $12.00 Made in the USA.

name: White Sage Incense by Juniper Ridge
description: We are proud to carry much of the Juniper Ridge Line including the best White Sage Incense that can be found in the United States! We are currently out of stock and will have it in both our shop and online store by the end of January. We Do carry though loose bulk ceremonial white sage in one (1) ounce bags for $8.00 per bag - check under our categories of culinary herbs & spices or under 'The Lucky Zen Dog' artist catagory http://beaconartemporium.bigcartel.com/product/white-sage-cermonial-smuding-white-sage-100-percent-organic Clean burning Â· No charcoal Â· 40 sticks per box.... With its incredibly real and aromatic resins, is the most highly prized Western Sage. It is found in the rugged mountains of the Southwest, where it is burned ceremonially in purification rituals. Its beautiful leaf clusters and enormous flowering stalks burst forth in the spring, painting streaks of white against the rusty green hillsides and filling the air with the pungent scent of wild Sage. This is the only Sage incense anywhere made with 100% real White Sage. $12 for 40 sticks -and oh yeah and it's made right here in the U.S.A.

name: Clematis Clematis Fine Art - Mixed Media on Canvas By Hudson Valley Artist Leah Quinn
description:
As with all my images, please click on the image to see a larger version so that you can realize the detail and fun color strokes.

This mixed media art is of a Clematis that grew on my back porch in the summer of 2011. 

Deep purple and bright greens creates a lovely simple scene of a flower in bloom. 

Feng Shui tip - did you know that clematis symbolism is ingenuity and mental beauty?

As with all my art, I make my art available in only very limited editions of 8. No more, no less. Once eight are sold - then no more can be, whether it is a print or on canvas.

Each is signed by the artist and is numbered.

Available as both as a print or printed on stretched gallery wrapped canvas up to size 24x36.

24x36 on canvas $380.00 on sale now
8x10 print with soy archival inks on fine art paper, with white mat included. - $38.00
5x7 print with soy archival inks on fine art paper, with white mat included. - $20.00

name: Beacon at Night Mixed Media Fine Art on Canvas by Beacon New York Artist Leah Quinn
description:
'Beacon at Night' is a multi-mixed media artwork available in several sizes both in print and on stretched canvas. 

Story Behind The Art: I was driving through grabbing some Thai Food at the local restaurant and when I turned around, the night lights were so beautiful I immediately grabbed my camera and took a photo. It is that photo which is the base of this piece. I then digitial water color the art by hand. And what you see is a slew of deep saturated jewel towens very much like I saw it that night.

The canvas is gallery wrapped whereby some of the image wrapped completely around the art work and you don't need any framing - though hanging hardware is included which each canvas.

Each piece of my art work is a complete original, all images are copyrighted 2011 by LeahQuinn.com. All rights reserved. Licensing Available Upon Request Only.

30"x40" Stretched Gallery Wrapped Canvas $525.00
20"x30" Stretched Gallery Wrapped Canvas $475.00
18"x24" Stretched Gallery Wrapped Canvas $375.00

name: Musical Flowers - Mixed Media Art Canvas by Leah Quinn
description: Mixed-Media Digital Art Created by Leah Quinn. Museum-Wrapped Canvas measures 24"x36". This art piece shows many layers of musical notes on a music sheet with spring tulips and and leaves of an oxalis plant. Made available printed on canvas with a gallery wrap. This limited edition canvas is $380.00 but is also available as an 8"x10" print ($38-) which is then matted, signed and numbered by the artist Leah Quinn.
